title: Brown v Board and Little Rock

content.prompt: On September 23, 1957, President Dwight Eisenhower signed a proclamation mandating the use of Arkansas National Guard members and federal armed forces to enforce the United States Supreme Court’s decision in Brown v. Board of Education (1954) in Little Rock, Arkansas. Which limitation on judicial power is demonstrated in this scenario?

choices.label: Constitutional amendments can modify the impact of the Supreme Court’s decisions.
Congressional legislation can impact the scope of the Supreme Court’s jurisdiction.
Judicial appointments can influence the decisions made by the Supreme Court.
State and local government can refuse to enforce Supreme Court decisions.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors illustrated in different scenarios in context.
